expertise: The lecturer's core expertise encompasses time series analysis, machine learning, and data mining techniques applied to financial forecasting (including cryptocurrency markets), autism spectrum disorder classification, and document image analysis, alongside expertise in database systems and e-commerce, with a focus on digital transformation strategies in higher education.

items: Time series forecasting (hybrid models, ARIMA, neural networks, fuzzy time series)

interests.group: Data Science and Machine Learning Applications
items: Data mining (association rule mining, cluster analysis, cyclic pattern mining)
Machine learning algorithms (SVM, Random Forest, Deep Learning)
Data analysis in healthcare and public health
Application of machine learning in blockchain and job recommendation systems
E-commerce analytics (Google Analytics, customer behavior analysis)
Web development and online booking systems
Digital transformation in higher education (Vietnamese universities)

expertise: The lecturer's core expertise lies in optimization modeling, algorithm design and analysis, with a specific focus on scheduling and resource allocation problems.

The lecturer's core expertise lies in applying machine learning, particularly in affective computing (including speech and facial expression recognition), fuzzy logic systems, and computer vision, to financial modeling (especially credit scoring), customer experience improvement, and the development of intelligent game systems and human-computer interaction, with a focus on applications for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs).
interests: Machine Learning for Finance and Affective Computing
Facial Expression and Speech Emotion Recognition
AI Applications for SMEs and Customer Service

expertise: The lecturer's core expertise lies in applying data mining and machine learning techniques, particularly deep neural networks, to social network analysis, focusing on community detection, topic modeling, and the development and improvement of recommendation systems, especially for scientific publications, including addressing challenges like author name disambiguation and data limitations.
interests: Developing and Improving Recommendation Systems (Scientific Publications, Addressing Data Limitations)
Social Network Analysis and Community Detection (Applications to Scientific Publications, Influencer Identification)
Topic Modeling and its Applications (Large Datasets, Parallelization, Efficiency Improvements), Data Creation and Ground Truth Development

expertise: The lecturer's core expertise lies in applying graph theory, graph algorithms, and spectral analysis techniques to bioinformatics problems, specifically focusing on protein structure analysis, comparison, and visualization using graph databases.  This expertise also encompasses machine learning, natural language processing, and text mining methods for analyzing biological data and online text corpora, including the development and application of classification systems.
interests: Graph-based bioinformatics and protein structure analysis
Text mining and Natural Language Processing applied to online content and bioinformatics
Machine learning algorithms and applications in bioinformatics and text analysis
